Class ec.ifc.app.ECTextView 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----netscape.application.View
           |
           +----netscape.application.TextView

                   +----ec.ifc.app.ECTextView
public class ECTextView
extends TextView
implements ECKeyFilter

ECTextView()
Returns a new ECTextView with bounds (0, 0, 0, 0)
ECTextView(int, int, int, int)
Returns a new ECTextView with bounds (x, y, width, height)

isOneLiner()
Returns whether or not this textView has exactly one line.
setDefaultJustification(int)
Sets the default justification of this textView to the specified value.
wantsEscapeKey()
Responsibility from ECKeyFilter.
wantsReturnKey()
Responsibility from ECKeyFilter.

ECTextView 
  public ECTextView()
Returns a new ECTextView with bounds (0, 0, 0, 0)
ECTextView 
  public ECTextView(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
Returns a new ECTextView with bounds (x, y, width, height)

isOneLiner 
  public boolean isOneLiner()
Returns whether or not this textView has exactly one line. No text at all counts as one line.
setDefaultJustification 
  public void setDefaultJustification(int justification)
Sets the default justification of this textView to the specified value. The value must be Graphics.LEFT_JUSTIFIED, Graphics.CENTERED, or Graphics.RIGHT_JUSTIFIED.
wantsEscapeKey 
  public boolean wantsEscapeKey()
Responsibility from ECKeyFilter. Returns false, so the escape key can be used to activate the cancel button.
wantsReturnKey 
  public boolean wantsReturnKey()
Responsibility from ECKeyFilter. Returns false if the text view is not editable, so the return key can be used to activate the default button.
